server.rest.controllers

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.rest.controllers.Controller
      • server.rest.controllers.UserController

  • @CrossOrigin(origins={"http://localhost:1234","http://theterminal.s3-website.us-west-2.amazonaws.com"})
 @RestController
public class UserController
extends Controller
    Controller for the User table in the database Provides all the REST endpoints related to Users and stored SQL procedures

      • editUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/users/edit")
public UsersEditResponse editUser(@RequestParam(value="token")
                                                                        java.lang.String token,
                                                                        @RequestParam(value="username")
                                                                        java.lang.String username,
                                                                        @RequestParam(value="password")
                                                                        java.lang.String password,
                                                                        @RequestParam(value="permissions")
                                                                        java.lang.String permissions)
        REST API to update an existing user
        Parameters:
        token - The Unique token of the User making the API call
        username - The username of the user to be updated
        password - The password of the user to be updated
        permissions - The permissions of the user to be updated
        Returns:
        Response with the Updated User or an error response

                                                                     java.lang.String permissions)

        Parameters:
        token - The unique token of the User making the API call
        username - The username of the new user
        password - The password of the new User
        permissions - The permissions of the new User
        Returns:
        Response with newly created user or an error response

public Response deleteUser(@RequestParam(value="token")
                                                                   java.lang.String token,
                                                                   @RequestParam(value="username")

                                                                   @RequestParam(value="usertodelete")
                                                                   java.lang.String usertodelete)
        Delete an existing user
        Parameters:
        token - The unique token of the User making the API call
        username - The username of the user making the API call
        usertodelete - The username of the user to be deleted
        Returns:
        Response stating whether the deletion was successful or not
